column5: Or buy 15 pairs from Dollarama for the same price! LOL  jjcanoe
We have Dollarama up here but I never looked for that, could use them today.    It's solid ice and pouring rain outside my door.  You can be sure I'll check next time I'm there.  Pam
maybe I'm just lucky with the boots I have or all those years of hockey gave me some balance but I've never had a need for cleats.  Reasonably soft soles seem to grip just fine.
15 pairs of pull on ice cleats.  $1/ pair  jjcanoe
A simple hip check would solve that.LOL  Dollar store you say. Just may need to take a gander for them.  Thanks for the heads up JJ
I'm gonna go with the 1/2" hex-head screws myself..
If you don't find them there Brian... "As seen on TV" in the Georgian Mall (upstairs.. far end by Home Sense).  $ 9.99  ... Had 4 pairs left when I left on the 23rd. Back left corner of the store.
crappieperchhunter did that to his icefishing boots man can he move on that ice........ thats the way to go!
Yeah they work real good. But Debbe's the only one who gets to see my REAL MOVES
Did anyone else notice this "Sno Wovel" thing on the right side of danbo's link?  I've seen it all now.
Wow---neat concept with the lever-action for lifting snow, but...$120?      Looks great if all you ever get is nice dry powdery snow.
Best $7 bucks I ever spent! 100 screws did 2 pairs of boots..
So you really dont have a few srcews loose then? LOL
Maybe a couple..then again, who doesn't?
